snippet: John Cosentino has spent 36 years at a Brooklyn institution. Now the state is moving disabled residents out. The change is wrenching.
abstract: John Cosentino, intellectually disabled adult who suffers from profound autism, will likely end up at group home when Brooklyn Developmental Center, where he spent last 36 years, closes; shutdown is part of New York State's long-planned process of deinstitutionalization; many advocates and officials believe less-restrictive care and community living are more humane for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities.
lead_paragraph: John Cosentino has spent 36 years at a Brooklyn institution. Now the state is moving disabled residents out. The change is wrenching.

headline.main: For Special-Care Residents, New York State Policy Means Leaving Home
